results.title: A Different World
results.brief_description: A Different World is a spin-off series from The Cosby Show centred on Denise Huxtable and students at Hillman College, a fictional mixed but historically black college in the state of Virginia.

constellations_other.name: Blizzard, Bowie and the Bonets
constellations_other.description: Overwatch is the beginning of some surprising connections in this Constellation that explores videogame movies, cartoons, and music docos and shows.

results.description:
A Different World is an American television sitcom which aired for six seasons on NBC. It is a spin-off series from The Cosby Show and originally centered on Denise Huxtable and the life of students at Hillman College, a fictional mixed but historically black college in the state of Virginia. After Bonet’s departure in the first season, the remainder of the series primarily focused more on Southern belle Whitley Gilbert and mathematics whiz Dwayne Wayne. The series frequently depicted members of the major historically black fraternities and sororities.

While it was a spin-off from The Cosby Show, A Different World would typically address issues that were avoided by The Cosby Show writers. One episode that aired in 1990 was one of the first American network television episodes to address the HIV/AIDS epidemic.
description_for_label:
A Different World is an American television sitcom which aired for six seasons on NBC. It is a spin-off series from The Cosby Show and originally centered on Denise Huxtable and the life of students at Hillman College, a fictional mixed but historically black college in the state of Virginia. After Bonet’s departure in the first season, the remainder of the series primarily focused more on Southern belle Whitley Gilbert and mathematics whiz Dwayne Wayne. The series frequently depicted members of the major historically black fraternities and sororities.

While it was a spin-off from The Cosby Show, A Different World would typically address issues that were avoided by The Cosby Show writers. One episode that aired in 1990 was one of the first American network television episodes to address the HIV/AIDS epidemic.

results.title: A Day at the Races
results.brief_description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse in this Marx Brothers classic.

constellations_other.name: When music speaks
constellations_other.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

results.description: Doctor Hugo Hackenbush, Tony, and Stuffy try and save Judy’s farm by winning a big race with her horse. There are a few problems. Hackenbush runs a high priced clinic for the wealthy who don’t know he has his degree in Veterinary Medicine.
description_for_label: Doctor Hugo Hackenbush, Tony, and Stuffy try and save Judy’s farm by winning a big race with her horse. There are a few problems. Hackenbush runs a high priced clinic for the wealthy who don’t know he has his degree in Veterinary Medicine.

results.title: A Cock and Bull Story
results.brief_description: Steve Coogan, an arrogant actor with low self-esteem and a complicated love life, is playing the eponymous role in an adaptation of “The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman” being filmed at a stately home. He constantly spars with actor Rob Brydon, who is playing Uncle Toby and believes his role to be of equal importance to Coogan’s.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

results.description: Steve Coogan, an arrogant actor with low self-esteem and a complicated love life, is playing the eponymous role in an adaptation of “The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman” being filmed at a stately home. He constantly spars with actor Rob Brydon, who is playing Uncle Toby and believes his role to be of equal importance to Coogan’s.
description_for_label: Steve Coogan, an arrogant actor with low self-esteem and a complicated love life, is playing the eponymous role in an adaptation of “The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman” being filmed at a stately home. He constantly spars with actor Rob Brydon, who is playing Uncle Toby and believes his role to be of equal importance to Coogan’s.

results.title: 8½
results.brief_description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. Urged by his doctors to rest, Anselmi heads for a luxurious resort, but a sorry group gathers—his producer, staff, actors, wife, mistress, and relatives—each one begging him to get on with the show. In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.
results.description: Guido Anselmi, a film director, finds himself creatively barren at the peak of his career. Urged by his doctors to rest, Anselmi heads for a luxurious resort, but a sorry group gathers—his producer, staff, actors, wife, mistress, and relatives—each one begging him to get on with the show. In retreat from their dependency, he fantasizes about past women and dreams of his childhood.

results.title: 42nd Street
results.brief_description: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.

constellations_other.name: Dancing on a dream
constellations_other.description: Mechanical lantern slides called chromotropes created wondrously complex patterns of light through sliding glass panels and internal gears.

results.description: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.
description_for_label: A producer puts on what may be his last Broadway show, and at the last moment a chorus girl has to replace the star.

results.title: 25th Hour
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Julia Chasman, Sandra Hernandez, Tobey Maguire, Jon Kilik, Spike Lee, James Chinlund and David Benioff
results.brief_description: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to preparing his girlfriend for his extended absence.

constellations_other.name: Post-9/11
constellations_other.description: The attacks on the World Trader Center in New York City on September 11 2001 were viewed on live television by audiences around the world. The effects of the attack have been explored across various forms of media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Touchstone Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Julia Chasman, Sandra Hernandez, Tobey Maguire, Jon Kilik, Spike Lee, James Chinlund and David Benioff
results.description: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven-year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to hanging out with his closest buddies and trying to prepare his girlfriend for his extended absence.
description_for_label: In New York City in the days following the events of 9/11, Monty Brogan is a convicted drug dealer about to start a seven-year prison sentence, and his final hours of freedom are devoted to hanging out with his closest buddies and trying to prepare his girlfriend for his extended absence.

results.brief_description: A contemporary, ensemble drama telling the complex tale of six high school students whose lives are interwoven with situations that so many of today’s youth are faced with.
results.description: At 2:37, someone commits suicide in the school lavatory. The day is told up to that point from the viewpoint of six different students.
description_for_label: At 2:37, someone commits suicide in the school lavatory. The day is told up to that point from the viewpoint of six different students.

results.title: Zelig
results.brief_description: A fictional documentary about the life of human chameleon Leonard Zelig, a man who becomes a celebrity in the 1920s due to his ability to look and act like whoever is around him.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

results.description: Fictional documentary about the life of human chameleon Leonard Zelig, a man who becomes a celebrity in the 1920s due to his ability to look and act like whoever is around him. Clever editing places Zelig in real newsreel footage of Woodrow Wilson, Babe Ruth, and others.
description_for_label: Fictional documentary about the life of human chameleon Leonard Zelig, a man who becomes a celebrity in the 1920s due to his ability to look and act like whoever is around him. Clever editing places Zelig in real newsreel footage of Woodrow Wilson, Babe Ruth, and others.

results.title: The Gulf Between
results.creator_credit: Anthony Paul Kelly and J. Parker Read Jr.
results.brief_description: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Paul Kelly and J. Parker Read Jr.
results.description: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.
description_for_label: The Gulf Between is a 1917 American comedy drama film that was the first motion picture made in Technicolor, the fourth feature-length color movie, and the first feature-length color movie produced in the United States.

results.title: The Great Train Robbery
results.creator_credit: Edwin S. Porter and Scott Marble
results.brief_description: Edwin S Porter’s The Great Train Robbery is considered one of the first westerns (and action films), which made use of many filmmaking techniques that were unconventional at the time including composite editing, on-location shooting, and frequent camera movement.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

results.description: After the train station clerk is assaulted and left bound and gagged, then the departing train and its passengers robbed, a posse goes in hot pursuit of the fleeing bandits.
description_for_label: After the train station clerk is assaulted and left bound and gagged, then the departing train and its passengers robbed, a posse goes in hot pursuit of the fleeing bandits.
